newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toyota, Kirloskar agree on joint car production.
newsitem.headline: Toyota, Kirloskar agree on joint car production.

text.p: Toyota Motor Corp said on Monday it had signed an agreement with India's Kirloskar Group on joint car production in India.
The venture will produce and sell a family-type multi-purpose vehicle designed for the Indian market, Toyota said in a statement.
Total investment in the venture, Toyota Kirloskar Motor Ltd, was $170 million, Toyota said.
The new company, located in Bidadi near Bangalore in Karnataka state, is scheduled to start production at the end of 1999, Toyota said.
The top Japanese car maker said the venture expects to produce 50,000 vehicles a year.
The Kirloskar Group is a leading Indian engineering group whose products include diesel engines, compressors, pumps, motors and castings, Toyota said.
